member.summary: The SpeechSynthesizer class provides methods to retrieve stream of audio file speaking text in various supported languages.

remarks.para: To use this library, you need to go to Azure DataMarket at https://datamarket.azure.com/developer/applications and register your application. In this way, you'll obtain the and that are necessary to use Microsoft Translator Service.

You also need to go to https://datamarket.azure.com/dataset/1899a118-d202-492c-aa16-ba21c33c06cb and subscribe the Microsoft Translator Service. There are many options, based on the amount of characters per month. The service is free up to 2 million characters per month.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the sentence to be spoken must be translated in the specified language.
member.value: true if the sentence to be spoken must be translated in the specified language; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: If you don't need to translate to text to be spoken, you can speed-up the the library setting the AutomaticTranslation property to false. In this way, the specified text is passed as is to the other methods, without performing any translation. The default value is true.

member.name: P:TranslatorService.Speech.SpeechSynthesizer.AutoDetectLanguage
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the language of the text must be automatically detected before text-to-speech.
member.value: true if the language of the text must be automatically detected; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: The AutoDetectLanguage property is used when the method is invoked. It this case, if the AutoDetectLanguage property is set to true, the language of the text is auto-detected before speech stream request. Otherwise, the language specified in the property is used.
If the language to use is explicitly specified, using the versions of the methods that accept it, no auto-detection is performed.
The default value is true.
